data.name: label7.Text
data.value: Games missing here? That's because there are only two games defined right now. Poke Tuxie (contact details in the about box). You might need to gift him the game in question, because he is a scrub. Or try and add it in games.json

data.name: label3.Text
data.value:
Here are probably the two most important settings. The first is pretty self-explanatory, its the game to map for. The second is which hammer and tools you want to use. The reason they are seperate is that Garrys Mod *needs* to use Source SDK Multiplayer Base instad of it's bundled hammer.
Game to map for:

data.name: label5.Text
data.value:
Welcome to TuxieLauncher! If this is the first time you have launched it, some introductions are in order.
This tool helps with setting up the ill-behaved Hammer level editor. It creates a new game directory, just for your mapping, where you can store all the materials, models, and other resources, seperate from the main game directory. This lets you create maps with custom textures and models, and what you see ingame while testing is exactly what your other players will see. The launcher automatically inserts an extra command that automatically packs any textures or models you are using inside of your map when you are compiling, so no need to launch a separate tool for that. The launcher also, when launching hammer, inserts a bit of code into it (dll injection, you can read more.. [todo: link :P]) just for that session, that redirects any access to any configuration files or registry keys. This both means that it shouldn't overwrite any of hammers configuration files, so you shouldn't need to worry about this launcher trampling any of your settings. (Then again, it might trample all of your hammer config files, set fire to any potential cats, and then gently lube your popcorn and turn your cereal mushy)
The rest of this page just shows you what information the launcher has gathered from your system. It should list both the installation folder of steam as the 'main steam directory', and all of the 'steam stores'. Steam stores is valves name for extra folders it can store games in, on any number of harddrives.
If anything looks wrong anywhere, poke Tuxie. Check the about button up on the top right for contact information.

data.name: label6.Text
data.value: Time to create the gamemode, so we can actually use Hammer. Below, you have a couple of settings. Fill them in, then hit 'create gamemode'. This will create the folder, fill it up with some standard content, settings, and some sample content to show that it works. Oh, and unlock the tool buttons above ;).
